channel.title: Grand exchange problm
channel.description:
This is delta base:
I got the ge from someone elses server and added some stuff blah blah but, the main problm is that when the server restarts it dose not save the fact that a player is saving an item for a price. So after the server restarts you lose your item.
If anyone could tell me how to make it save i would love you!

item.title: Grand exchange problm
item.dc:creator: @gelert gelert
item.description:
@gelert wrote:

[quote=“int i, post:18, topic:290906”][quote author=gelert link=topic=384590.msg2885479#msg2885479 date=1248573580]
Well, i was thinking when the player execuites the command ::sell (id) (amount) (price)
That it writes (playername(seller) (item id) (amont) (price) in a txt file and retrieve them opone restart
but, i wouldn’t have a damn clue on how to do that…
[/quote]

like the appendToBanned(String) method, have something write to text files. the command would look like this. you would have to do ::sell ID AMOUNT PRICE (each)

if(command.startsWith("sell")) { String[] cmd = command.split(" "); int id = cmd[1]; int amount = cmd[2]; int price = cmd[3]; writeSell(playerName, id, amount, price); sendMessage("You try to sell "+amount+" of "+getItemName(id)+" at "+price+" gp each."); }

keep in mind price is each per item.[/quote]

This is delta base[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 01, 2009, 10:02:14 am[/size][hr]Why dose it seem that nobody can help me with this?

Read full topic

but, the main problem is that the items wont stay in the server when it gose of if i sell an item it goes in ::checkge it says the item name item id price amount etc and i want everything to save just the way it was before the server restarted…

item.title: Grand exchange problm
item.dc:creator: @gelert gelert
item.description:
@gelert wrote:

writeSell(playerName, id, amount, price);

“Sell” is the file that the server writes the information on i assume, but when the server restarts it will not know what “playername, itemid, amount, price” is or to evan add that to the server, also sadly my hosting computer broke <(-.-)> feel free to laugh.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand exchange problm
item.dc:creator: @int_i int i
item.description:
@int_i wrote:

[quote=“gelert, post:13, topic:290906”]Well, i was thinking when the player execuites the command ::sell (id) (amount) (price)
That it writes (playername(seller) (item id) (amont) (price) in a txt file and retrieve them opone restart
but, i wouldn’t have a damn clue on how to do that…[/quote]

like the appendToBanned(String) method, have something write to text files. the command would look like this. you would have to do ::sell ID AMOUNT PRICE (each)

if(command.startsWith("sell")) { String[] cmd = command.split(" "); int id = cmd[1]; int amount = cmd[2]; int price = cmd[3]; writeSell(playerName, id, amount, price); sendMessage("You try to sell "+amount+" of "+getItemName(id)+" at "+price+" gp each."); }

keep in mind price is each per item.

item.title: Grand exchange problm

@gelert wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: Grand exchange problm
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Tatemo:

I dont think the server can modify java files while its running…

It most certainly can. Just use either REflection or BCEL, with teh comiler class, and then use a ClassLoader subclass in order to defineClass(name, binaryBytes, offset, binaryBytes.length);

The easiest way, would be to make a text file that contains all information, like the itemID, amount, player selling, player’s price etc, make it parse all that info on startup, and than, when the actionButton is clicked, cycle through all the info that was loaded, and then save/load the information, depending on if you bought, or sold something.

Read full topic
